result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron C. Morris

records.addlTxt: Applicant is eligible for SPD Services, no attorney assigned.

11:01 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Aaron C. Morris in court, in custody. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Court contacted the SPD Office before the hearing and they advised the Court that the DE called them on 9/19/22 stating he did not want an attorney. DE states that is incorrect, he would like an attorney has been attempting to contact the SPD Office to check on the status of his new counsel. Court calls the SPD Office while on the record; SPD Office shall continue to search for new counsel for the DE. Court will adjourn to allow the SPD office time to appoint counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
for Attorney Shamali to withdraw as counsel of record

09:23 AM   State appeared by Attorney Drew Lehman. Defendant, Aaron C. Morris, appeared in custody with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Shamali's motion to withdraw. Discussion held. Both Attorney Shamali and the DE are requesting Attorney Shamali be withdrawn from this case. Court will grant the motion and allow Attorney Shamali to withdraw. SPD is to appoint new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Shamali.  Clerk. M.Burke. The speedy trial demand is withdrawn. PTC set to 08/19/22 at 9:00.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Aaron C. Morris, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Shamali. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived.    DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned.Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Atty in court today.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
DE requests substitution of Br 3; Br 2 assigned.

01:29 PM    Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary Hearing set on May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am. before Comm , 927-54th Street, Room 157, Kenosha, WI.  Bond continued.  ts
filed by Atty. Chad Shamali  kmk
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Aaron C. Morris in court, in custody.  Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
SPD has not yet secured representation.  kmk

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Salvador G-H, Mayra G, Luis I.

01:32 PM  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on April 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  kmk
and witness list filed by the State
